intro: Blakea trinervis, commonly known as the red-veined evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Ecuador, and Peru. Blakea trinervis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and hardy nature.
